result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew K Christensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

1:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  FTP $579.00.  Statement by defendant - now has a job and can pay $100.00 per month.  Court orders defendant to pay $100 per month commencing April 1, 2016 and every month thereafter.  Court quashes the warrant.

FTP Hearing 01-25-2016 for $579.00

43

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Christina at GLSO.
43

2:50 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant requests to get this taken care of.  DA recites offer, upon plea, will recommend a fine and costs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts offer.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:57 p.m.
